name: Higher-Order Thinking
description: Meta-cognitive reflection and complex reasoning about thinking processes

steps.name: Examine Thinking Processes - Analyze how you think
steps.description:
Reflect on and analyze the thinking processes being used to approach the problem

ðŸ§  ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Step back and examine your thinking process: What approaches are you using? What assumptions are you making about how to think about this? What cognitive biases might be affecting your analysis? How is your thinking process itself shaping your conclusions?

steps.name: Evaluate Thinking Quality - Assess cognitive approach
steps.description:
Critically evaluate the quality and appropriateness of the thinking strategies

ðŸ§  ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Evaluate your thinking strategies: Are you using the most appropriate cognitive approaches? What are the strengths and limitations of your current thinking? Could different thinking strategies yield better insights? What thinking patterns should you change?

steps.name: Synthesize Multiple Perspectives - Integrate complex viewpoints
steps.description:
Integrate insights from multiple thinking approaches and perspectives

ðŸ§  ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Synthesize multiple levels of analysis: How do different thinking approaches complement each other? What emerges when you combine analytical, creative, and intuitive perspectives? What higher-level patterns become visible?

steps.name: Design Thinking Strategies - Plan cognitive approach
steps.description: Deliberately design thinking strategies for complex problems

steps.name: Monitor and Adjust - Regulate thinking process
steps.description: Continuously monitor and adjust thinking processes for optimal results
